intro: Hieracium neorupicola subsp. riofrioi, commonly known as the Rio Friol Hieracium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaves arranged in a basal rosette. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow to orange, with ray florets that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow leaves and compact growth form, making it a unique member of the Hieracium genus.
